as well as a good block card
it's like guardian's version of <Shrug it Off>

if you don’t have <planning> / <guardian stasis 4 cards top of deck> can be useful

messages.content: draw cheating with stasis+accelerate is pretty good

embeds.title: Recover
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :e_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Gain 5 (8) **Block** :p_block:.
**Brace** 3 (4).
Place a card from your discard pile into **Stasis.**

messages.content: Very solid card in general. Playing this for free out of stasis feels extremely powerful, and it's a great target to loop with reroute and recover. The upgrade is very impactful, helping add some additional draw power to guardian, who can often use it well due to the number of 0 cost cards in their pool. Gets a lot better if you have dex scaling from the debuff package and emerald. Plays very well with body slam+. Can be a little risky to take this too early in the run, usually you start wanting copies early in act 2, and you can definitely grab one near the end of act 1 if you have an easy boss fight. Goes particularly well with planning and suspension, which are both enablers and payoffs for this effect. Certainly you do need a reasonable amount of ways to get cards in stasis to support this, but it's pretty unusual for me to not be taking those kinds of cards extremely highly anyways (sentry blast, future plans, planning, recover, reroute). This card really shines in the late game when your stasis engine is up and running, but is still very useful throughout the middle of the run as well. I often want 2 of these if I can find them as I approach the lategame to be able to draw through the deck very quickly.
Yeah this is a very good card. Not a floor 1 pick, but anywhere past like floor 10 if I have 2-3 stasis cards it's a really good pick. Also will often take in act 3.
Which I feel like most commons either completely pop off or fall off in act 3
majority fall off but some have secondary effects that are way easier to activate and gain more value the more you have of it
early pickup its not bad, just some extra block which is nice act 1. Later floors/acts its great, pretty much a better backflip 99% of the time
IC can afford to take a shrug it off on floor 1 because he has <Bash>

embeds.title: Bash
embeds.description:
Basic Attack / 2 :e_red: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Deal 8 (10) damage.
Apply 2 (3) **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.

messages.content: Guardian does not have that extra offence that IC has
even if you started with ruby
i meant early as in act 1 basically, but yeah, even with upgraded <twin slam> Guardian *really* needs to be taking attacks in early floors

embeds.title: Twin Slam
embeds.description:
Basic Attack / 1 :e_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Deal 5 (7) damage.
Gain a Second Slam. (+.)
[ **Socket** ] ( [ **Socket** ] )

messages.content: yeah I'll take a temporal shield like late act 1

but a card being bad the first 10 floors, then being great the rest of the game is not bad at all, and its a common too, so its not like skipping it floor 1 is going to be something you regret most of the time
but it's because Nic200 said temporal shield isn't a floor 1 pick
which I agree with
i also agree
*although* what i agree with isnt always what i do, because i have a bad habit of taking cards that will be good later instead of good now/soom
Guardian is a character that really punishes that habit, so its basically shock therapy
same
I try to restrain myself but sometimes it's really hard to not go for the greed
"surely i will find an onyx or resilient plate later" *on my third ancient power*
I love this card. I usually take it, though I tend to play with Stasis anyway. It's one of my favorite deck types.

I tend to find that guardian has in inherently insane late game if you can get stasis going in any major way. Longer boss fights just get destroyed by the ability to play so many cards for free, especially with time eater and the heart missing. The debuff package can also carry late game very hard, and socketing gems can also create cards that are extremely efficient and packed with value at that stage. Because of all that, I tend to really skew towards solving my early game problems on them, you can find tons of solutions for act 3 and act 4, but you will struggle in act 1 if you don't respect gremlin nob (and other fights that are very short) and draft those upfront damage commons. You have to eat your vegetables and find solutions to short hallway fights early, and later you will have plenty of opportunities to scale out of control. Temporal shield is fantastic, but I don't want any copies until I know gremlin nob is out of the way
<Temporal Shield> reworked:

embeds.title: Temporal Shield
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :e_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Gain 8 (11) **Block** :p_block:.
**Accelerate.**

messages.content: Pinned a message.
Oh my word, that's a huge rework.
Tragic, but understandable.
That amount of draw on a common card was too much for a character who could also make cards free.
it's a defend+ with an amber now
idk how good this is because I haven't played with it yet

It seems more in-line with common cards now, especially since Guardian has quite a few stasis cards. I dare say that the added Accelerate might still make it really good in stasis builds without being overly powerful like the older iteration was.
Yeah defend++ with accelerate, seems still pretty strong.
8(11) block is quite a lot still.

Almost a completely different card now. It does still reward you for having cards in stasis, and it does still technically have the ability to draw you cards, but it feels very different. The change to the upgrade is especially notable, the old draw 2 upgrade was excellent for guardian to really churn through their deck in the late-game. Other sources of pure card draw will become more valuable as a result, and you will need to be more careful about the positioning of your stasis cards, you really want to play this with a 1 tick stasis card on the far right to effectively draw a card and gain an energy.
Yeah, I will probably have to add some draw to Guardian's card pool next time I will be doing mayor stuff to it, especially since few other draw cards are on the list for changes.

Overload+, quartz and stasis engine seem to be the main tools left. To be fair, stasis is effectively "drawing cards", it just happens on a later turn or requires accelerate to get access to them earlier. Guardian is also so good at blocking that having to wait a turn or two is pretty manageable
Ahem.

I think that there is a big difference between being card neutral and card positive.
  That said sometimes **Exploit Gems** is the second.
Yeah, **Stasis** can be card positive that said draw effects are important for setting up, or increasing consistency at the start of the fight.
